remarks: An interval-closed set ` A ` in a total order has the same subspace topology as the restricted order topology.  (An interval-closed set is the same thing as an open or half-open or closed interval in ` RR ` , but in other sets like ` QQ ` there are interval-closed sets like ` ( _pi , +oo ) i^i QQ ` that are not intervals.)  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 9-Sep-2015.)  (Revised by Thierry Arnoux, 11-Sep-2018.)

ordtrest2NEW $p |- ( ph -> ( ordTop ` ( .<_ i^i ( A X. A ) ) ) = ( ( ordTop ` .<_ ) |`t A ) ) $.
